resources.string:
Even with eyes protected by the green spectacles Dorothy and her friends were at first dazzled by the brilliancy of the wonderful City. The streets were lined with beautiful houses all built of green marble and studded everywhere with sparkling emeralds. They walked over a pavement of the same green marble, and where the blocks were joined together were rows of emeralds, set closely, and glittering in the brighness of the sun. The window panes were of green glass; even the sky above the City had a green tint, and the rays of the sun were green. 

There were many people, men, women and children, walking about, and these were all dressed in green clothes and had greenish skins. They looked at Dorothy and her strangely assorted company with wondering eyes, and the children all ran away and hid behind their mothers when they saw the Lion; but no one spoke to them. Many shops stood in the street, and Dorothy saw that everything in them was green. Green candy and green pop-corn were offered for sale, as well as green shoes, green hats and green clothes of all sorts. At one place a man was selling green lemonade, and when the children bought it Dorothy could see that they paid for it with green pennies. 

There seemed to be no horses nor animals of any kind; the men carried things around in little green carts, which they pushed before them. Everyone seeemed happy and contented and prosperous.

Touch the fingerprint sensor to unlock your device, make purchases, or sign in to accounts. Be careful whose fingerprints you add. Just one fingerprint can be used to do any of these things.

Note: Your fingerprint may be less secure than a strong pattern or PIN.
Learn more

Just touch the fingerprint sensor to authorize purchases, or sign in to apps. Be careful whose fingerprints you add. Even one added print can do any of these things.\n\nNote: You can\u2019t use your fingerprint to unlock this device. For more information, contact your organization\u2019s admin.

Just touch the fingerprint sensor to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps. Be careful whose fingerprints you add. Even one added print can do any of these things.\n\nNote: Your fingerprint may be less secure than a strong pattern or PIN.
Device protection features will not be enabled. You will not be able to prevent others from using this device if it is lost, stolen, or reset to factory default settings.
Device protection features will not be enabled. You will not be able to prevent others from using this device if it is lost or stolen.
Locate the fingerprint sensor on the back of your phone.
Illustration with device and fingerprint sensor location
Put your finger on the sensor and lift after you feel a vibration
Move your finger slightly to add all the different parts of your fingerprint
Whenever you see this icon, you can use your fingerprint for identification or to authorize a purchase.
Just touch the fingerprint sensor to wake and unlock your device.
When you see this icon, you can use your fingerprint.
You\u2019ve chosen to use your fingerprint as one way to unlock your phone. If you skip now, you\u2019ll need to set this up later. Setup takes only a minute or so.
Use the fingerprint sensor on your device.
Fingerprint enrollment time limit reached. Try again.
Fingerprint enrollment didn\'t work. Try again or use a different finger.
In addition to unlocking your phone, you can also use your fingerprint to authorize purchases and app access. Learn more
Screen lock option disabled. You can still use your fingerprint to authorize purchases and app access. Learn more
Lift finger, then touch sensor again
You can add up to %d fingerprints
You won\'t be able to use your fingerprints to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them.
You won\'t be able to use your fingerprints to unlock your work profile, authorize purchases, or sign in to work apps.
Protect your device by encrypting its data.
Protect your device by using a screen lock when your device powers on.
Protect your device by using a screen lock when your device powers on.

You can encrypt accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files.\n\nEncryption takes an hour or more. Before you start, ensure that the battery is charged and keep the device plugged in until encryption is complete. Interrupting this process may lead to the loss of some or all of your data.
Charge your battery over 80% and try again.
Set screen unlock password before you can start encryption.
The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you\u2019ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the tablet will restart several times.

Encrypting your device cannot be reversed and data will be lost if the process is interrupted. Encryption could take an hour or more, during which your device will restart several times and you will not be able to use it.
Encrypting device. This may take some time. Please wait...\n%d%% complete.
Please wait while device is encrypted.\n\n%d%% complete.
Please wait while phone is encrypted.\n\n%d%% complete.
To start up your device, power it off, power it on again, then try again.

To start up your device, power it off, power it on again, then try again. You must draw the pattern you use to start up the device and unlock the screen. Your backup PIN cannot be used to start up your device.
Unable to start up your device. The encryption process was interrupted. You need to reset your device to factory default settings. This will erase all your data.

The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt. \n\nTo resume using your tablet, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your tablet after the reset, you\u2019ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.

The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt. \n\nTo resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you\u2019ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.
Select a screen lock type, such as Fingerprints.
Your fingerprint may be less secure than a strong pattern, PIN, or password. For added security, set up a backup screen lock.
Prevent others from using this tablet without your permission by activating device protection features. Choose the screen lock you want to use.
Prevent others from using this device without your permission by activating device protection features. Choose the screen lock you want to use.
Prevent others from using this phone without your permission by activating device protection features. Choose the screen lock you want to use.

Change or disable pattern, PIN, or password.
You can unlock your phone using your fingerprint. For security, this option requires a backup screen lock.
Once you\u2019ve set up a screen lock, you can also set up your fingerprint in Settings > Security.

When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts, and more.\n\nJust bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then tap your screen. The app determines what gets beamed.

WARNING: if you skip Wi\u2011Fi, your device will only use cellular data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to Wi\u2011Fi.
WARNING: You may incur extra carrier data charges.\n\nPhone setup can require significant network activity.

If you skip Wi‑Fi setup:

- Your device will not have an Internet connection.

- You will not get software updates until you connect to the Internet.

- You will not be able to use device protection functions.

Type a network prefix length between 0 and 32
Automatically switch between Wi-Fi and mobile networks to maintain a stable Internet connection.
Automatically switch between Wi-Fi and mobile data and save frequently used Wi-Fi networks.
Switch to using a mobile network to access the Internet when your Wi-Fi Internet connection becomes unstable. This may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Switch to using a mobile network to access the Internet even when your Wi-Fi Internet connection is only slightly unstable. This may increase your data usage.
%1$s may not provide internet access. Tap CONNECT to stay connected to %2$s.
Your phone will also connect to this network when it\'s available in the future.
You can change this in Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Adaptive Wi-Fi > Network exceptions.
%1$s may not provide Internet access.\nTap CONNECT to stay connected to %2$s now and whenever you connect to it in future, even when Smart network switch is enabled.
To change this later, go to Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart network switch, then delete this network.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch > Network Exceptions.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch > Network Exceptions.

%1$s has a weak internet connection. Smart Network Switch is turned on, so you'll be switched to a mobile network when your Wi-Fi connection is weak.

To prevent the switch whenever you are connected to %2$s, tap STAY CONNECTED.

Or, tap ALLOW SWITCH to switch to a mobile network whenever the %3$s internet connection is weak.
Tap OK to connect to another available network whenever your Wi-Fi connection is unstable.
Mobile data may be used to maintain a stable Internet connection. This may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
To enable or disable Smart network switch later, go to Settings > Wi-Fi, then tap MORE and select Smart network switch.
To enable or disable Smart network switch later, go to Settings > Wi-Fi > MORE, then tap Advanced and select Smart network switch.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch.
To enable or disable Smart network switch later, go to Settings > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED, then select Smart network switch.
To enable or disable Smart network switch later, go to Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED, then select Smart network switch.

If Smart network switch is enabled, your device will be connected to a mobile network automatically when the Wi-Fi connection is unstable. This may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Your phone switched to mobile data because the Wi-Fi network was unstable.
This may result in additional charges.
Smart Network Switch automatically switched you to the mobile network, because the Wi-Fi network you were connected to had a weak Internet connection.\n\nData usage applies.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch.
To change this setting at any time, go to Settings > Connections > Wi-Fi > ADVANCED > Smart Network Switch.
Your phone will remain connected to these networks, even if the connection is unstable
%1$s will be removed from Network exceptions.
Your phone will remain connected to these networks even when Smart network switch is on.
Your tablet will remain connected to these networks even when Smart network switch is on.
This function is disabled. No SIM card has been inserted.
This feature is disabled because Flight mode is enabled.
This feature has been disabled because mobile data is disabled.
Disconnecting will end your connection with %s
Disconnecting will end your connection with %1$s and %2$s other devices
Use cellular connection to provide Wi\u2011Fi network
AndroidAP WPA2 PSK portable Wi\u2011Fi hotspot
Use Wi-Fi instead of mobile network

When Wi-Fi calling is on, your phone can route calls via Wi-Fi networks or your carrier\u2019s network, depending on your preference and which signal is stronger. Before turning on this feature, check with your carrier regarding fees and other details.
Address used by emergency services as your location if you make a 911 call using WiFi
Use incoming call volume for notifications
Set volume for music and videos.
Audio settings for the attached dock
Settings for the attached desktop dock
Settings for the attached car dock
You need to dock the tablet before setting up dock audio.
You need to dock the phone before setting up dock audio.
Play sound when inserting or removing tablet from dock
Play sound when inserting or removing phone from dock
Don\u2019t play sound when inserting or removing tablet from dock
Don\u2019t play sound when inserting or removing phone from dock
Switch orientation automatically when rotating device.
Switch orientation automatically when rotating device.
Adjust the brightness of the screen
Optimize brightness level for available light
Night Light tints your screen amber. This makes it easier to look at your screen or read in dim light, and may help you fall asleep more easily.
Will turn on automatically at sunset.
Will turn off automatically at sunrise.
When docked or asleep and charging.
Control what happens while the device is docked and/or charging. The screensaver will be shown after the screen times out.\n\nThis function is also called Daydream.
Wake screen when you receive notifications
Require your SIM card PIN to unlock and use your SIM card.
Require your SIM card PIN to unlock and use your SIM card.
Enter your current SIM card PIN.
Enter a new SIM card PIN.
Enter the new SIM card PIN again to confirm it.
Unable to change PIN. Incorrect PIN may have been entered.

resources.string: Show status of battery, network, and other information.
Disconnect USB storage, view available storage.
Disconnect SD card, view available storage.
Erase all data from SD card, including music and photos.
Unmount the SD card so you can safely remove it
Insert an SD card for mounting
Erases all data on the internal USB storage, such as music and photos
Erases all data on the SD card, such as music and photos
This will clear cached data for all apps.
MTP or PTP function is active
If you unmount the USB storage, some apps you are using will stop and may be unavailable until you remount the USB storage.
If you unmount the SD card, some apps you are using will stop and may be unavailable until you remount the SD card.
Couldn\u2019t unmount USB storage. Try again later.
Couldn\u2019t unmount SD card. Try again later.
Some system functions, such as syncing, may not work correctly. Try to free space by deleting or unpinning items, such as apps or media content.
Allows you to transfer media files in Windows, or using Android file transfer on a Mac (see www.android.com/filetransfer).
Allows you to transfer photos using camera software, and transfer any files onto PC that do not support MTP.
Lets MIDI enabled applications work over USB with MIDI software on your computer.
Security policy restricts use of SD card.
This %1$s is unmounted.\n\nTo use it, it must be mounted.
The data on this %1$s is corrupt.\n\nTo use it, it must be set up.
To use this %1$s, it must be set up.

After formatting, you will not be able to use this %1$s in other devices.

All data on this storage device will be erased. Back up your data first to avoid data loss.

Back up pictures and media files
Move your media files to your device storage, or transfer them to a PC using a USB cable.

Back up apps
All apps stored on this storage device will be uninstalled and their data will be erased. To keep these apps, move them to your device storage.

This %1$s will be unmounted. You will not be able to use apps stored on it, and media files stored on it will not be available until it is mounted again.\n\nThis storage device is formatted to work on this device only. It cannot be used on other devices.
This %1$s will be deregistered. It will be formatted and all data will be erased and cannot be recovered. Apps stored on it can be reinstalled by visiting the relevant store.
All data on the %1$s will be erased. This data cannot be recovered.

The category called Other includes app data, files downloaded from the Internet or via Bluetooth, and Android system files.\n\nTap EXPLORE to view details of this content on the %1$s being used as internal storage.
%1$s has saved data that is using %2$s of your device storage.\n\nTo view details of this data, change to using this account.
Transfer images and other media between devices.
Use this SD card with this device only. This requires formatting the SD card which will also prevent it from working with other devices.

The %1$s will be formatted to make it secure.

After formatting, it will only work in this device. 

Formatting erases all data currently stored on this %2$s. To avoid data loss, back it up before formatting.
The %1$s will be formatted to make it secure. \n\nFormatting erases all data currently stored on the %2$s. To avoid data loss, back up data before you format the %3$s.
Formatting %1$s...\n\nDo not remove it while it is being formatted.

You can export your pictures, files, and some apps to this %1$s. \n\nThis will take approximately %2$s and will make %3$s available in your device storage. Some apps cannot be used while the data is being exported.

string.name: storage_wizard_migrate_confirm_body
string.b: The selected data will be exported. This will take approximately %1$s and will make %2$s available in your device storage.

resources.string:
During the export: 

• Do not remove the %1$s. 

• Some apps will not work correctly. 

• Make sure that the battery is charged and keep the device plugged in.
Your %1$s is ready to be used. \n\nTo export media, such as images, and other files to it, go to Settings, then select Storage.
Your %1$s is ready to be used. \n\nTo export images, files, and app data to it, go to Settings, then select Storage.

Exporting %1$s and its data to %2$s... 

This will only take a few moments. The app cannot be used while it is being exported.

Do not remove the %3$s during the export.
Do not remove the %1$s during the transfer. \n\nThe %2$s app will not be available until the transfer is complete.

This %1$s is slow. 

Apps exported to this location may run with reduced performance and data transfers to this location may take a long time. 

Consider using a faster SD card or USB storage device to improve performance.
The Name field cannot be empty.
MNC field must be 2 or 3 digits.
This will reset all network settings, including those for:
All connection settings will be reset. This action cannot be undone.
Network reset is not available for this user

"This will erase all data from your tablet’s internal storage, including:


Your Google account

System and app data and settings

Downloaded apps"

"This will erase all data from your phone’s internal storage, including:


Your Google account

System and app data and settings

Downloaded apps"
You are currently signed in to the following accounts:.

When this feature is enabled, you can quickly enable accessibility features in 2 steps.

1. Press and hold the power key until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.

2. Tap and hold with two fingers until you hear audio confirmation.

If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked.

When this feature is on, you can quickly turn on accessibility features in 2 steps.

1. Press and hold the Power key until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.

2. Press and hold with two fingers until you hear audio confirmation.

If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily turns on accessibility until the device is unlocked.

You can further protect this device by requiring that your PIN be entered before it starts up. This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices.\n\nYou will not receive any calls, messages, or notifications, and alarms will not sound, until the device has started up.

You can further protect this device by requiring that your pattern be drawn before it starts up. This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices.\n\nYou will not receive any calls, messages, or notifications, and alarms will not sound, until the device has started up.

You can further protect this device by requiring that your password be entered before it starts up. This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices.\n\nYou will not receive any calls, messages, or notifications, and alarms will not sound, until the device has started up.

In addition to using your fingerprint to unlock your device, you can further protect this device by requiring that your PIN be entered before the device starts up.
